tweet:
This is devastating. In this country, no one should be just one paycheck away from not being able to afford food or housing. We need tax reform that benefits middle income Americans, an increase in the minimum wage and investments in our small businesses – as a start.

What else? https://twitter.com/CBSNews/status/1090363951114842112 …

Big thanks to @Alyssa_Milano for coming by to talk about how we can get the Equal Rights Amendment over the finish line. Equal protection under our Constitution isn’t a partisan issue — it’s a basic human rights one. Glad to have your support on this. Let’s get it done. #ERANow pic.twitter.com/9Br92mFOU6

Couldn't agree more. Gender equality should be explicitly protected by our Constitution, and I'm proud to be working with you, @RepMaloney and @LisaMurkowski to get that done. Let's get the ERA across the finish line. #ERANow https://twitter.com/RepSpeier/status/1090265587551428615 …

Thanks for all your work on this, @Alyssa_Milano. Looking forward to seeing you tomorrow to discuss how we can get the #ERA over the finish line. #ERANow https://twitter.com/Alyssa_Milano/status/1089318934602371072 …

.@LisaMurkowski and I agree: women should not be provided fewer protections under the law because of their gender. This is a human rights issue, not a partisan one. Gender equality should be an explicit principle of our society — and our Constitution. #ERA https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/its-time-to-finally-pass-the-equal-rights-amendment/2019/01/25/54b3626e-20d0-11e9-9145-3f74070bbdb9_story.html …

With @POTUS’ senseless #shutdown finally over, let us take away this lesson: federal workers are dedicated, hardworking civil servants. They run our airports, our food safety, our natl security, our economy. They deserve our thanks and Americans deserve the services they provide.

I thank all of those who worked w/o pay for their dedication and those who were needlessly locked out of their jobs on furlough. The American people now have a better understanding of the critical role you play in our communities and across the country.

I was proud to work w/Democratic and Republican colleagues to find a path forward. With passage of this CR, federal employees and contractors who have been working thru tremendous hardship, can finally reclaim their lives and get back to their work.

Last night, we brought a large, bipartisan group of senators together who all agreed that too many critical functions of our govt have been disrupted, and too many workers have been hurt by this needless shutdown. Today, we are on our way to quickly reopening the federal govt.
https://www.pscp.tv/w/bxowyzFQbUtxWFdwWnJ4UW98MU1ueG5ObVZ3bUx4T-MsLrd5i_l-Eknrm0sneFDeopJS_Cq7MUjKfx2B6eEi …
We have bipartisan momentum to #EndtheShutdown https://www.pscp.tv/w/bxot_TFQbUtxWFdwWnJ4UW98MWdxR3ZuT3d5WGpHQouEqMXZLsTDP5T_SjQBjj5MgNSxMOQ3NwfE89Bf2-hn …

Right now: @lisamurkowski and I are on the Senate floor calling for the passage of a clean CR to reopen the government for 3 weeks. This would be paired with a commitment to engage in good faith negotiations on border security. #EndTheShutdown

Watch live:  https://www.c-span.org/congress/?chamber=senate …

Spent the morning at @DawsonsMarket talking to small business owners affected by this shutdown.

In a word? Devastating. Small businesses are the heart of our economy, and right now, they're struggling. They deserve better than this senseless, unnecessary chaos. #EndTheShutdown pic.twitter.com/p6P0VydxmM

Today I visited @ChefJoseAndres' relief kitchen for federal workers and talked to those struggling under this senseless #shutdown. Huge, heartfelt thanks to the whole #ChefForFeds operation for stepping up in the midst of this chaos and helping those who both need and deserve it. pic.twitter.com/722H4FqDpa

Today I had the chance to thank the many volunteers from @MDFoodBank @AFLCIO @IBEW @AFGENational who organized a much-needed food bank in Baltimore for federal workers hurt by the #TrumpShutdown. Such great work to help those devastated by this completely unnecessary crisis. pic.twitter.com/XiqV2z1rxN – at IBEW Local 24 Electricians Union

We all want secure borders. We want protections for #Dreamers and TPS recipients. I stand firmly for both. But reopening govt must be our first priority. We cannot have a reasonable/good faith debate on border security while @POTUS continues to use a functioning govt as leverage.

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. is famous for having a dream. But what made him a force of history, what made him remarkable, was his unstoppable drive to bring that dream to life. Today I commit myself – and call on all Americans – to follow in his footsteps. #MartinLutherKingJrDay

Dr. King taught us that civil rights is not a fixed destination, but an evolving journey whose path we must walk together.

This #MartinLutherKingJrDay, let's keep walking. Let's recommit ourselves and our country to Dr. King's ideals: equality, justice and respect for all. pic.twitter.com/1ba7k38H55

In a speech called “a plan to reopen the government,” we unfortunately heard very little about the urgency of reopening the government.

We must do that first. Then we can have a debate about @realDonaldTrump’s ideas on border security. #EndTheShutdown

28 days into the #TrumpShutdown and @SenateMajLdr is still abdicating his responsibilities as leader of the US Senate.

We are a co-equal branch of government with the votes to override a veto. Instead, @SenateMajLdr is awaiting instructions from @POTUS. https://thehill.com/blogs/floor-action/senate/425945-mcconnell-blocks-bill-to-reopen-most-of-government …

The shutdown is broader than the federal workforce; it’s the services that they provide that are cut off. We’ve heard directly from MD biz who cannot ship products overseas b/c the govt agency that provides the export licenses they need is shuttered. SBA is not funding loans.

#SmallBiz typically do not have the cashflow to ride out a dramatic loss or delay of income. For the sake of our economy, we need to @EndtheShutdown now. #smallbusinessesarenervouswithgoodreason pic.twitter.com/wLz2Xx2RCK

We are hearing from #SmallBusiness that the “partial” govt shutdown is having an affect far and wide. Permits and licenses are not being processed. Loans are being approved but sit unfunded. Access to capital is essential for small biz survival, but that is being choked.

Small businesses are the backbone of our economy and they are hurting right now because of the #TrumpShutdown ... I appreciate all those sharing their challenges today. @ChrisVanHollen and I are working to end this. pic.twitter.com/en87sxnBZf
The longer this shutdown goes on, the more risks we are taking with our nation and keeping everyone in our country safe. https://twitter.com/PGCOC/status/1085907848154869761 …

Glad that my bill guaranteeing back pay for federal workers was signed into law today.

But the promise of back pay will not cover the cost of rent or groceries today. It won't make a car payment or cover prescriptions. A few of many reasons why it's past time to #EndTheShutdown pic.twitter.com/Cx0LpygRAf

In 1 hour, @POTUS will sign my bill guaranteeing back pay for federal workers into law.

This is an important step toward providing our civil servants with some stability and hope. But it doesn't help pay the bills *now.* To do that, we MUST reopen the government. #EndTheShutdown

I just sent @realDonaldTrump a letter asking that he listen to the stories of those suffering under his #shutdown.

But he needs to hear directly from you. To all those impacted, to our federal workers – share your #ShutdownStories here.

Help us put an end to this chaos. pic.twitter.com/KtZL4dY5A6

@BWI_Airport with workers from Transportation Security Administration (AFGE), Professional Aviation Safety Specialists (PASS), and National Air Traffic Controllers Association (NATCA) calling for an immediate end to the #TrumpShutdown. Our safety and security depends on it. pic.twitter.com/DI4n7kPwZ5

“When it comes to border security, it's a discussion that needs to be had. But federal employees shouldn't be used as a bargaining chip." Well said. Couldn't agree more. #EndTheShutdown https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/trafficandcommuting/air-traffic-controllers-get-their-first-shutdown-pay-stub-000/2019/01/10/080255e4-1525-11e9-b6ad-9cfd62dbb0a8_story.html?utm_term=.54a69d1e91f7 …

On this first day that so many federal workers – hundreds of thousands still on the job – are missing their paycheck, the House has passed my bill to guarantee back pay once the #TrumpShutdown is over. I hope @POTUS will keep his word and sign this into law. #EndTheShutdown pic.twitter.com/WUY7vTb7bD

On this #WearBlueDay, an impressive group of advocates, law enforcement officers and survivor-leaders from across Maryland joined me to exchange perspectives on how we can best #endmodernslavery. pic.twitter.com/nPfll9zVc0

With @ChrisVanHollen in Howard County to hear from @HoCoGovExec and some of the 800,000 federal employees being asked to survive without paychecks. The #TrumpShutdown is having serious real-world consequences, yet the Senate GOP leadership still refuses to focus on ending it. pic.twitter.com/LEZuPJaFgR

Together now w/@AFLCIO &so many brothers and sisters of Labor in support our federal workers. Let’s #EndTheShutdown https://www.pscp.tv/w/bwd2eTFQbUtxWFdwWnJ4UW98MXZBeFJ5ZG1YcVBKbOEjXCXaIYnQOphxIm00SqJU-xGHQMo_G9-kpf3GIN7q …

Happening now: I'm heading to the Senate floor to ask @SenateGOP for unanimous consent to reopen the government. This senseless #shutdown has gone on too long. The adult thing to do is to put an end to it.

Watch my request, and their response, live: https://twitter.com/i/broadcasts/1jMKgOZMqVXKL …

Right now 41,000+ federal law enforcement officers are working without pay because of your shutdown.

-2,614 ATF agents
-13,709 FBI agents
-4,399 DEA agents
-3,600 Deputy U.S. Marshals
And more.

Don't just tweet about supporting them. Actually support them. End this #shutdown. https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1083083858357248000 …

The takeaway from tonight's #PresidentialAddress: this is a policy in search of a crisis. The president is trying to manufacture an emergency to justify holding the U.S. government hostage over his wall.

Enough theatrics and hyperbole, @POTUS. Reopen the government.

"This is about national security."

FACT: 85% of watch-listed individuals attempting to enter the U.S. do so by air. 

Of those few who *do* try to enter by land, the majority do so by trying to cross the U.S.-Canadian border.  https://www.apnews.com/4a7792c523ab4b5984893b38c988d70b …
#TrumpAddress

.@POTUS is peddling fear. Again.

The #1 way illegal drugs cross the U.S.-Mexico border? In passenger vehicles coming through our Ports of Entry – with people crossing otherwise legally.

Don't take my word for it. Real facts have sources:  https://www.dea.gov/sites/default/files/2018-11/DIR-032-18%202018%20NDTA%20final%20low%20resolution.pdf …
#TrumpAddress

.@POTUS continues to peddle fear to sell his wall. Let’s get back to facts and have real conversation about border security. We can start by reopening the Gov’t so we can pay border patrol, customs agents, TSA agents and others who are on the front lines. #TrumpAddress

FACT: In the first half of FY ’18, Customs & Border Protection apprehended only 6 individuals AT THE BORDER whose names were on a terrorist screening list. The @WhiteHouse has offered no evidence to the contrary. https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/immigration/only-six-immigrants-terrorism-database-stopped-cbp-southern-border-first-n955861 …

At no point did @realDonaldTrump address why we can’t reopen parts of the Gov’t that have nothing to do with border security. Why is he holding @StateDept @DOJ @CommerceGov @USDOT @NatlParkService and all the Americans they serve hostage? #EndTheShutdown
Democrats want to provide border agents with paychecks. Better technology? Absolutely. Let’s reopen the government and make that happen.

Disappointed in the Guatemalan government's decision to terminate #CICIG. This is an extremely dangerous setback for anti-corruption and accountability efforts in the region. Congress must respond. https://twitter.com/amnestypress/status/1082710214221156352 …

Why does reopening the government need to be our first order of business?

Here's one reason why. American families are struggling. We simply cannot turn a blind eye to that and pretend as if this is all just business as usual. #Shutdown https://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/government-shutdown-federal-workers_us_5c34abdde4b01e2d51f77054 …

Dozens of U.S. government agencies are shut down.

Law enforcement officers, TSA agents, the Coast Guard, many others are working without pay. 380,000 are out of work entirely.

This is a crisis, @SenateMajLdr. Our first order of business must be to address it. #TrumpShutdown

I've worked closely with you on BDS, @MarcoRubio, and disagree with you here. The government #shutdown is a crisis, impacting millions of Americans and our economy. We can't simply proceed with business as usual. Reopening the govt must be our first priority. #EndTheTrumpShutdown https://twitter.com/marcorubio/status/1082276008760360960 …

The Senate should not take up any bills unrelated to reopening the government until @SenateMajLdr lets us vote on exactly that.

This is not business as usual. This is a crisis and a failure to govern. Dozens of govt agencies are shut down. We must reconcile that first. #Shutdown

Our dedicated federal workers aren't pawns. They shouldn't have to wonder when their next paycheck may come just because @realDonaldTrump thinks a wall is a substitute for immigration reform. So this week, my colleagues and I introduced legislation that would guarantee back pay. pic.twitter.com/CglI3x667D

Agreed. This isn’t business as usual. This is a crisis, a fundamental failure to govern, and Americans are suffering for it. 

The Senate should not take up any bills unrelated to reopening the government until @SenateMajLdr lets us vote on exactly that. #Shutdown https://twitter.com/ChrisVanHollen/status/1081612549332877312 …

Right now:
-420,000 federal workers, like Coast Guard and DEA agents, are being forced to work without pay.
-380,000, such as Forest Service firefighters, have been furloughed.

@ChrisVanHollen and I are leading the charge to right these wrongs and ensure they get paid. #Shutdown

Day 15 of the #TrumpShutdown.

While @POTUS holds the govt hostage over a wall, federal workers suffer. These are members of the Coast Guard, law enforcement officers, NASA employees. And right now, they can't afford their bills. That's shameful. I've introduced a bill to help. pic.twitter.com/YuwqLTeaO6

Remember: the bill @SpeakerPelosi has put forth to reopen the govt is something both Dems *and* Republicans agreed to just a couple months ago, before @POTUS threw a tantrum.

Time to end the theatrics. We're ready to govern. @POTUS is the only one who's not. #GovernmentShutdown pic.twitter.com/xsQeZHMNMX

This is madness. Keeping the government shut down does not demonstrate strength. It demonstrates incompetence and an inability to govern.

As usual, @realDonaldTrump is confusing the two at Americans' expense. #TrumpShutdown https://twitter.com/cnnbrk/status/1081272859069202432 …

Today I took the oath of office, swearing to defend the Constitution of the United States. To me, that means defending the values that make this country great: freedom, equality, diversity, tolerance, the rule of law.

That's what I'll keep fighting for every day. #116thCongress pic.twitter.com/o9xaAbV8BZ

No, the people of this country see that you're holding the government hostage over the delusion that a wall will fix our broken immigration system.

Stop the theatrics. Govern. We're ready to fund and reopen the government. You're the only one who's not. #TrumpShutdown https://twitter.com/thehill/status/1080574201562574856 …

Happy New Year, Maryland! It's been a privilege to represent you in the Senate this past year. Here's to 2019 – may it be a peaceful, hopeful year for you and your family. #HappyNewYear2019 pic.twitter.com/mhZgFQXrEL
